remarks: Assuming the operation ` F ` is commutative, show that the relation ` .~ ` , specified by the first hypothesis, is symmetric. (Contributed by NM, 27-Aug-1995.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2015.)
statement:
ecopopr.1 $e |- .~ = { <. x , y >. | ( ( x e. ( S X. S ) /\ y e. ( S X. S ) ) /\ E. z E. w E. v E. u ( ( x = <. z , w >. /\ y = <. v , u >. ) /\ ( z .+ u ) = ( w .+ v ) ) ) } $.
ecopopr.com $e |- ( x .+ y ) = ( y .+ x ) $.
ecopovsym $p |- ( A .~ B -> B .~ A ) $.
$d .+ u v w x y z $.
$d S u v w x y z $.
